books.description: Nora Seed finds a library beyond the edge of the universe that contains books with multiple possibilities. Read by Carey Mulligan. 8 hours, 50 minutes unabridged.
books.title: THE MIDNIGHT LIBRARY

books.author: Taylor Jenkins Reid
books.description: A movie icon recounts stories of her loves and career to a struggling magazine writer. Read by Alma Cuervo, Julia Whelan and Robin Miles. 12 hours, 10 minutes unabridged.
books.title: THE SEVEN HUSBANDS OF EVELYN HUGO

books.author: Patricia Cornwell
books.description: The 25th book in the Kay Scarpetta series. Scarpetta investigates crime scenes in Virginia and outer space. Read by Susan Ericksen. 11 hours, 53 minutes unabridged.
books.title: AUTOPSY

books.author: Will Smith with Mark Manson
books.contributor: by Will Smith with Mark Manson
books.description: The actor, producer and musician tells his life story and lessons he learned along the way. Read by Will Smith. 16 hours, 16 minutes unabridged.
books.title: WILL

books.author: Matthew McConaughey
books.description: The Academy Award-winning actor shares snippets from the diaries he kept over the last 35 years. Read by the author. 6 hours, 42 minutes unabridged.
books.title: GREENLIGHTS

books.author: Dave Grohl
books.description: A memoir by the musician known for his work with Foo Fighters and Nirvana. Read by the author. 10 hours, 35 minutes unabridged.
books.title: THE STORYTELLER

books.author: edited  Nikole Hannah-Jones, Caitlin Roper, Ilena Silverman and Jake Silverstein
books.contributor: edited by Nikole Hannah-Jones, Caitlin Roper, Ilena Silverman and Jake Silverstein
books.contributor_note: edited by Nikole Hannah-Jones, Caitlin Roper, Ilena Silverman and Jake Silverstein
books.description: America’s entanglement with slavery and its legacy is told through expanded essays first published in The New York Times Magazine. Read by Nikole Hannah-Jones and a full cast. 18 hours, 57 minutes unabridged.
books.title: THE 1619 PROJECT

books.author: Mel Brooks
books.description: The EGOT and Kennedy Center honoree shares stories about making comedy for the stage, film and television. Read by the author. 15 hours, 6 minutes unabridged.
books.title: ALL ABOUT ME!

books.author: Bruce D. Perry and Oprah Winfrey
books.contributor: by Bruce D. Perry and Oprah Winfrey
books.description: An approach to dealing with trauma that shifts an essential question used to investigate it. Read by the authors. 8 hours, 27 minutes unabridged.
books.title: WHAT HAPPENED TO YOU?

books.author: Bessel van der Kolk
books.description: How trauma affects the body and mind, and innovative treatments for recovery. Read by Sean Pratt. 16 hours, 17 minutes unabridged.
books.title: THE BODY KEEPS THE SCORE

books.author: Robert F. Kennedy Jr
books.description: The anti-vaccine advocate gives his take on the chief medical advisor to the president. Read by  Bruce Wagner. 27 hours, 20 minutes unabridged.
books.title: THE REAL ANTHONY FAUCI

books.author: Yuval Noah Harari
books.description: How Homo sapiens became Earth’s dominant species. Read by Derek Perkins. 15 hours, 17 minutes unabridged.
books.title: SAPIENS

books.author: David Graeber and David Wengrow
books.contributor: by David Graeber and David Wengrow
books.description: A reinvestigation of social evolution and suggestions for new ways of organizing society. Read by Mark Williams. 24 hours, 2 minutes unabridged.
books.title: THE DAWN OF EVERYTHING

books.author: Jocko Willink and Leif Babin
books.contributor: by Jocko Willink and Leif Babin
books.description: Applying the principles of Navy SEALs leadership training to any organization. Read by the authors. 8 hours, 15 minutes unabridged.
books.title: EXTREME OWNERSHIP

books.author: Patrick Radden Keefe
books.description: A portrait of the Sackler family, known for their philanthropy toward institutions around the world, and their involvement with Valium and OxyContin. Read by the author. 18 hours, 6 minutes unabridged.
books.title: EMPIRE OF PAIN

books.author: Adam Grant
books.description: An examination of the cognitive skills of rethinking and unlearning that could be used to adapt to a rapidly changing world. Read by the author. 6 hours, 40 minutes unabridged.
books.title: THINK AGAIN

books.author: Michelle Zauner
books.description: The daughter of a Korean mother and Jewish-American father, and leader of the indie rock project Japanese Breakfast, describes creating her own identity after losing her mother to cancer. Read by the author. 7 hours, 23 minutes unabridged.
